definition: To make or become less in size, importance, or value.
example: The importance of traditional skills has diminished over time.

definition: Relating to one's own country; relating to the home or family.
example: Domestic tourism has increased due to travel restrictions.

definition: Having power, influence, or control; most important or noticeable.
example: English has become the dominant language in international business.

definition: A preliminary version of a piece of writing; to prepare a draft.
example: Submit your first draft by the end of the week.

definition: Sudden and striking; relating to drama or the theater.
example: There has been a dramatic increase in online learning.

definition: The length of time something continues or exists.
example: The duration of the experiment was three months.

definition: Characterized by constant change, activity, or progress.
example: The technology sector is highly dynamic and competitive.

definition: Relating to economics or the economy.
example: Economic growth has slowed in recent years.

definition: To prepare written material for publication by correcting or modifying.
example: Please edit your essay before submitting it.

definition: A component or part of something; a basic principle.
example: Critical thinking is an essential element of education.

definition: To completely remove or get rid of something.
example: The goal is to eliminate poverty by 2030.

definition: To come into existence; to become visible or apparent.
example: New technologies continue to emerge in the healthcare sector.

definition: Special importance or attention given to something.
example: There is increasing emphasis on sustainable development.

definition: Based on observation or experience rather than theory.
example: The study provides empirical evidence for the theory.

definition: To make possible or provide the means to do something.
example: Technology enables people to work from anywhere.

definition: To meet or experience something unexpectedly.
example: Students may encounter difficulties when learning a new language.

definition: Power derived from physical or chemical resources.
example: Renewable energy sources are essential for the future.

definition: To compel observance of a law or rule.
example: The government plans to enforce stricter environmental laws.

definition: To increase or improve the quality or value of something.
example: Technology can enhance the learning experience.

definition: Very large in size, quantity, or extent.
example: The project requires an enormous amount of resources.

definition: To make certain that something happens or is the case.
example: We must ensure that all students have equal opportunities.

definition: A thing with distinct and independent existence.
example: The company operates as a separate legal entity.

definition: To consider one thing as equal to or equivalent to another.
example: We should not equate wealth with happiness.

definition: To supply with necessary items for a particular purpose.
example: Schools must equip students with skills for the future.

definition: Equal in value, function, or meaning.
example: The two qualifications are considered equivalent.

definition: To gradually destroy or diminish something.
example: Coastal erosion has eroded the cliffs significantly.

definition: A mistake; the state of being wrong in conduct or judgment.
example: Learning from errors is an important part of education.

definition: Relating to a group with a common cultural tradition.
example: The city has a diverse ethnic population.

definition: To judge or assess the value or condition of something.
example: Teachers evaluate students based on multiple criteria.

definition: In the end; after a period of time or series of events.
example: Eventually, renewable energy will replace fossil fuels.

definition: Information indicating whether something is true or valid.
example: There is strong evidence linking exercise to better health.

definition: To develop gradually over time.
example: Technology continues to evolve at a rapid pace.

definition: To go beyond or be greater than a limit or expectation.
example: The results exceeded our expectations.

definition: To prevent from being included or considered.
example: The study excludes participants under 18 years old.

definition: To display or show; a public display of items.
example: The museum will exhibit ancient artifacts.

definition: To increase in size, number, or importance.
example: The company plans to expand into new markets.

definition: A person with extensive knowledge in a particular field.
example: Experts recommend reducing sugar intake.

definition: Stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion.
example: The instructions must be explicit and easy to follow.

definition: To make full use of; to use unfairly for one's advantage.
example: Companies should not exploit workers in developing countries.

definition: To reveal or make something visible; to subject to risk.
example: Children should not be exposed to harmful content online.

definition: Relating to the outside; coming from outside.
example: External factors also influence student performance.

definition: To remove or take out; a short passage from a text.
example: Scientists extract DNA from biological samples.

definition: To make an action or process easier.
example: Technology facilitates communication across borders.

definition: A distinctive characteristic; to have as a prominent part.
example: One key feature of the app is its user-friendly interface.

definition: Relating to a system of government with central and regional powers.
example: The federal government introduced new healthcare policies.

definition: A payment made for professional services.
example: University tuition fees have increased significantly.

definition: A folder for keeping documents; to submit documents officially.
example: Please file your application before the deadline.

definition: Coming at the end; ultimate; decisive.
example: The final exam will cover all topics from the semester.

definition: Having limits or bounds; not infinite.
example: Natural resources are finite and must be used wisely.

definition: The quality of being able to adapt or change easily.
example: Flexibility in working hours improves work-life balance.

definition: To rise and fall irregularly in amount or level.
example: Oil prices fluctuate according to global demand.

definition: The center of attention; to concentrate on something.
example: The study focuses on the effects of climate change.

definition: The arrangement or style of something; to arrange in a format.
example: The essay should follow the required format.

definition: The basis for something; an organization for charitable purposes.
example: Good education forms the foundation for success.

definition: A basic structure underlying a system or concept.
example: The theoretical framework guides the research methodology.

definition: A sum of money for a purpose; to provide money for.
example: The government will fund research into renewable energy.

definition: Forming a necessary base; of central importance.
example: Access to education is a fundamental human right.

definition: In addition; besides.
example: Furthermore, the study found a link between diet and mood.

definition: The state of being male or female; social roles based on sex.
example: Gender equality is essential for social development.

definition: To produce or create something.
example: Solar panels generate electricity from sunlight.

definition: All people born around the same time; the production of something.
example: Each generation faces unique challenges and opportunities.

definition: Relating to the whole world; comprehensive.
example: Global warming affects every country on Earth.

definition: An aim or desired result.
example: The main goal of education is to develop critical thinking.

definition: A level of quality or rank; to evaluate academic work.
example: Students receive grades based on their performance.

definition: Financial aid for study; to give or allow something.
example: She received a grant to fund her research project.

definition: A promise that something will happen; to promise with certainty.
example: Education does not guarantee success, but it helps.

definition: A general rule or piece of advice.
example: The government issued guidelines for healthy eating.

definition: For this reason; as a consequence.
example: The study was flawed; hence, the results are unreliable.

definition: A system in which people or things are ranked according to status.
example: Traditional workplaces often have a strict hierarchy.

definition: To emphasize or make prominent.
example: The report highlights the need for educational reform.

definition: A proposed explanation to be tested through research.
example: The hypothesis was supported by the experimental data.

definition: Exactly alike; the same.
example: The twins are almost identical in appearance.

definition: A system of ideas forming the basis of economic or political theory.
example: Different ideologies shape government policies.

definition: Lack of knowledge or information.
example: Ignorance of the law is not an acceptable excuse.

definition: To explain or make clear by examples or diagrams.
example: The diagram illustrates how the process works.

definition: A visual representation; the general impression of something.
example: The company is trying to improve its public image.

definition: To come to live permanently in a foreign country.
example: Many people immigrate to seek better opportunities.

definition: A marked effect or influence; to have a strong effect on.
example: Technology has had a significant impact on education.

definition: To put a decision, plan, or agreement into effect.
example: The government will implement new environmental policies.

definition: Implied though not directly expressed.
example: There was implicit criticism in his comments.

definition: To suggest indirectly; to indicate by inference.
example: The results imply that further research is needed.

definition: To force something unwelcome on someone.
example: The government imposed new taxes on luxury goods.

definition: Something that motivates or encourages someone to act.
example: Tax incentives encourage investment in renewable energy.

definition: The rate at which something occurs.
example: The incidence of diabetes is increasing worldwide.

definition: To lean toward an opinion; a slope or slant.
example: I am inclined to agree with the first argument.

definition: To contain as part of a whole.
example: The price includes accommodation and meals.

definition: To include as part of something larger.
example: The design incorporates elements of traditional architecture.

definition: An alphabetical list; a statistical measure of change.
example: The consumer price index measures inflation.

definition: Originating or occurring naturally in a particular place.
example: Indigenous cultures have valuable traditional knowledge.

definition: To bring about or cause something to happen.
example: Stress can induce various health problems.

definition: Certain to happen; unavoidable.
example: Change is inevitable in today's rapidly evolving world.

definition: To conclude from evidence or reasoning.
example: We can infer from the data that the treatment is effective.

definition: The basic facilities and systems serving a country or organization.
example: Investment in infrastructure is essential for economic growth.

definition: Existing as a natural or basic part of something.
example: There are inherent risks in any investment.

definition: To prevent or slow down an action or process.
example: Fear of failure can inhibit creativity.

definition: Existing or occurring at the beginning.
example: The initial results were promising but inconclusive.

definition: To cause a process or action to begin.
example: The company initiated a new training program.

definition: The introduction of new ideas, methods, or products.
example: Innovation is key to staying competitive in business.

definition: What is put in; to enter data into a computer.
example: Your input on this project would be valuable.

definition: To place or fit something into another thing.
example: Insert the card into the machine to begin.
